required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Omarigliptin (MK-3102) in Participants With Impaired Renal Function (MK-3102-009)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Two-Part, Single-Dose Study to Investigate the Pharmacokinetics, Safety and Tolerability of MK-3102 in Patients With Impaired Renal Function

brief_summary.textblock: This is a 2-part study in participants with renal impairment and matched healthy participants to investigate the effect of impaired renal function on the plasma and urine levels of omarigliptin (MK-3102) after taking a single 3 mg dose by mouth.

detailed_description.textblock: In Part I, three panels of 6 participants each will be enrolled with varying degrees of renal disease (mild, moderate, or severe renal impairment) based on their estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR). Each of these panels will be matched with a corresponding panel of equal number of healthy, age-, race-, BMI- and gender-matched control participants. All panels will receive a single oral dose of 3-mg omarigliptin, followed by plasma sampling and urine collection. In Part II, 6 participants with end stage renal disease (ESRD) requiring hemodialysis will receive a single 3-mg oral dose of omarigliptin immediately following hemodialysis (HD) (Period 1) and 2 hours prior to HD (Period 2).There will be approximately 1 month between Period 1 and Period 2. A corresponding panel of equal number, healthy matched control subjects (age, race, BMI, gender) will also receive a single 3 mg dose by mouth. Omarigliptin dose administration will be followed by plasma sampling for both panels.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 to Infinity (AUC0-∞) of Omarigliptin
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 (Panel G only), 96, 168, 240, and 336 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: AUC0-∞ is a measure of the mean concentration levels of drug in the plasma after the dose.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 (Panel G only), 96, 168, 240, and 336 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Cmax is a measure of the maximum amount of drug in the plasma after the dose is given.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 to 168 Hours Post Dose (AUC0-168h) of Omarigliptin
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 (Panel G only), 96, and 168 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: AUC0-168h is a measure of the total amount of drug in the plasma from the dose to 168 hours after the dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Concentration at 168 Hours Post-dose (C168h) of Omarigliptin
primary_outcome.description: C168h is a measure of the plasma drug concentration 168 hours post-dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Volume of Distribution (Vd/F) of Omarigliptin
primary_outcome.description: Vd/F is defined as the distribution of a medication between the plasma and the rest of the body after the dose. It is the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of the drug.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Total Body Clearance (CL/F) of Omarigliptin
primary_outcome.description: CL/F is a calculation of the rate at which a drug is removed from the body via renal, hepatic, and other clearance pathways, expressed as volume (milliliters) per unit of time (minutes).

CLr is a calculation of the rate at which a drug is removed from the body via renal clearance pathways, expressed as volume (milliliters) per unit of time (minutes). CLr was only determined for Panels A-F.

primary_outcome.measure: Fraction of Dose Excreted Unchanged in Urine Through 48 Hours Post-dose (fe48h) of Omarigliptin
primary_outcome.description: fe48h is expressed as percentage of omarigliptin not metabolized and excreted in urine. fe48h was only determined for Panels A-F.

primary_outcome.measure: Cumulative Amount of Drug Excreted in Urine Over 48 Hours (Ae0-48h) of Omarigliptin
primary_outcome.description: Ae0-48h is a measure of the cumulative amount of drug excreted in the urine for 48 hours post-dose. Ae0-48h was only determined for Panels A-F.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Concentration (Tmax) of Omarigliptin
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 (Panel G only), 96, 168, 240, and 336 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Tmax is a measure of the time to reach the maximum drug plasma concentration post-dose.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 (Panel G only), 96, 168, 240, and 336 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: T1/2 is the time required for the maximum concentration of a drug in the plasma to decrease by 50%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing an Adverse Event (AE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From pre-dose to 14 days post-dose (Up to Day 15)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was defined as any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure (signs), function (symptoms), or chemistry (laboratory data) of the body temporally associated with any use of a Sponsor product, whether or not considered related to the use of the product.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Withdrawn From Study

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 1: Control to Match Panel A (Panel B)
Part 1: Control to Match Panel C (Panel D)
Part 1: Control to Match Panel E (Panel F)
Part 2: End-stage Renal Disease needing hemodialysis (Panel G)
Part 2: Control to Match Panel G (Panel H)

intervention.description: Single oral dose of 3 mg (3 x 1-mg capsules)
intervention.arm_group_label: Part 1: Control to Match Panel A (Panel B)
Part 1: Control to Match Panel C (Panel D)
Part 1: Control to Match Panel E (Panel F)
Part 2: End-stage Renal Disease needing hemodialysis (Panel G)
Part 2: Control to Match Panel G (Panel H)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Impaired Renal Function Subjects:
- Females of reproductive potential must have a negative pregnancy test and agree to use 2 methods of birth control
- Diagnosis of renal insufficiency based on estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) calculated using the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equation
Healthy Subjects:
- Females of reproductive potential must have a negative pregnancy test and agree to use 2 methods of birth control;
- In general good health
Exclusion Criteria:
Impaired Renal Function Subjects:
- Is mentally or legally incapacitated
- Has rapidly fluctuating renal function or has demonstrated or suspected renal artery stenosis
- History of significant endocrine (other than Type 2 diabetes), gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, hematological, immunological, respiratory, or genitourinary diseases
- History of stroke, chronic seizures or major neurological disease
- Uncontrolled Type 2 diabetes or history of Type 1 diabetes or ketoacidosis
- History of cancer (Some exceptions apply)
- Regular user of barbiturates or sleep aides
- Consumes excessive amounts of alcohol (more than 2 drinks/day)
- Consumes excessive amounts of caffeinated beverages (more than 6/day)
- Has had major surgery or has lost or donated 1 unit of blood within 4 weeks
- Has a history of significant multiple and/or severe allergies
- Current or history of illicit drug abuse
- Nursing mothers
Healthy Subjects:
- Is mentally or legally incapacitated;
- Has a history of stroke, chronic seizures, or major neurological disorder
- Renal impairment
- History of clinically significant endocrine, gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, hematological, immunological, respiratory, or genitourinary diseases
- Hypoglycemia, glucose intolerance, Type 1 or Type 2 diabetes, or ketoacidosis
- History of cancer (Some exceptions apply)
- Regular user of barbiturates or sleep aides
- Consumes excessive amounts of alcohol (more than 2 drinks/day)
- Consumes excessive amounts of caffeinated beverages (more than 6/day)
- Has had major surgery or has lost or donated 1 unit of blood within 4 weeks
- Has a history of significant multiple and/or severe allergies
- Current or history of illicit drug abuse
- Nursing mothers

participant_flow.recruitment_details: One healthy matched control participant withdrew consent for study participation on Day 15; this participant was replaced. Thus, a total of 49 participants were in the study.

group.title: Part 1: Mild Renal Impairment (Panel A)
group.description: Participants with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) ≥60 - <80 mL/min/1.73 m² were enrolled in the Mild Renal Impairment group.

group.title: Part 1: Control to Match Panel A (Panel B)
group.description: Participants with eGFR >/= 80 mL/min/1.73 m² were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel A.

group.title: Part 1: Moderate Renal Impairment (Panel C)
group.description: Participants with eGFR ≥30 - <60 mL/min/1.73 m² were enrolled in the Moderate Renal Impairment group.

group.title: Part 1: Control to Match Panel C (Panel D)
group.description: Participants with eGFR >/= 80 mL/min/1.73 m² were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel C.

group.title: Part 1: Severe Renal Impairment (Panel E)
group.description: Participants with eGFR <30 mL/min/1.73 m² but not on dialysis were enrolled in the Severe Renal Impairment group.

group.title: Part 1: Control to Match Panel E (Panel F)
group.description: Participants with eGFR >/= 80 mL/min/1.73 m² were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel E.

group.title: Part 2: ESRD Requiring HD (Panel G)
group.description: Participants with end-stage renal disease (ESRD) requiring hemodialysis (HD)

group.title: Part 2: Control to Match Panel G (Panel H)
group.description: Participants with eGFR >/= 80 mL/min/1.73 m² were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel G.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 to Infinity (AUC0-∞) of Omarigliptin
outcome.description: AUC0-∞ is a measure of the mean concentration levels of drug in the plasma after the dose.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 (Panel G only), 96, 168, 240, and 336 hours post-dose
outcome.population: All participants that received a single 3 mg dose of omarigliptin.

group.title: Part 2: ESRD Requiring HD (Panel G) - Period 1
group.description: Participants with end-stage renal disease (ESRD) requiring hemodialysis (HD) were enrolled in Panel G. In Period 1, participants received MK-3102 3 mg immediately after HD. One participant did not have an estimable parameter.

group.title: Part 2: Control to Match Panel G (Panel H) - Period 1
group.description: Participants were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel G. Data from the participant that withdrew from study was not included.

group.title: Part 2: ESRD Requiring HD (Panel G) - Period 2
group.description: Participants with ESRD requiring HD were enrolled in Panel G. In Period 2, participants received MK-3102 3 mg 2 hours prior to HD.

group.title: Part 2: Control to Match Panel G (Panel H) - Period 2
group.description: Participants were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel G. Data from the participant that withdrew from study was not included.

outcome.title: Renal Clearance (CLr) of Omarigliptin
outcome.description: CLr is a calculation of the rate at which a drug is removed from the body via renal clearance pathways, expressed as volume (milliliters) per unit of time (minutes). CLr was only determined for Panels A-F.
outcome.population: All participants that received a single 3 mg dose of omarigliptin.

group.title: Part 1: Mild Renal Impairment (Panel A)
group.description: Participants with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) ≥60 - <80 mL/min/1.73 m² were enrolled in the Mild Renal Impairment group.

group.title: Part 1: Control to Match Panel A (Panel B)
group.description: Participants with eGFR >/= 80 mL/min/1.73 m² were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel A.

group.title: Part 1: Moderate Renal Impairment (Panel C)
group.description: Participants with eGFR ≥30 - <60 mL/min/1.73 m² were enrolled in the Moderate Renal Impairment group.

group.title: Part 1: Control to Match Panel C (Panel D)
group.description: Participants with eGFR >/= 80 mL/min/1.73 m² were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel C.

group.title: Part 1: Severe Renal Impairment (Panel E)
group.description: Participants with eGFR <30 mL/min/1.73 m² but not on dialysis were enrolled in the Severe Renal Impairment group.

group.title: Part 1: Control to Match Panel E (Panel F)
group.description: Participants with eGFR >/= 80 mL/min/1.73 m² were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel E.

measure.title: Renal Clearance (CLr) of Omarigliptin
measure.description: CLr is a calculation of the rate at which a drug is removed from the body via renal clearance pathways, expressed as volume (milliliters) per unit of time (minutes). CLr was only determined for Panels A-F.
measure.population: All participants that received a single 3 mg dose of omarigliptin.

outcome.title: Fraction of Dose Excreted Unchanged in Urine Through 48 Hours Post-dose (fe48h) of Omarigliptin
outcome.description: fe48h is expressed as percentage of omarigliptin not metabolized and excreted in urine. fe48h was only determined for Panels A-F.
outcome.population: All participants that received a single 3 mg dose of omarigliptin.

measure.description: fe48h is expressed as percentage of omarigliptin not metabolized and excreted in urine. fe48h was only determined for Panels A-F.

outcome.title: Cumulative Amount of Drug Excreted in Urine Over 48 Hours (Ae0-48h) of Omarigliptin
outcome.description: Ae0-48h is a measure of the cumulative amount of drug excreted in the urine for 48 hours post-dose. Ae0-48h was only determined for Panels A-F.
outcome.population: All participants that received a single 3 mg dose of omarigliptin.

group.title: Part 1: Mild Renal Impairment (Panel A)
group.description: Participants with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) ≥60 - <80 mL/min/1.73 m² were enrolled in the Mild Renal Impairment group.

measure.description: Ae0-48h is a measure of the cumulative amount of drug excreted in the urine for 48 hours post-dose. Ae0-48h was only determined for Panels A-F.
measure.population: All participants that received a single 3 mg dose of omarigliptin.

outcome.title: Time to Maximum Concentration (Tmax) of Omarigliptin
outcome.description: Tmax is a measure of the time to reach the maximum drug plasma concentration post-dose.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 (Panel G only), 96, 168, 240, and 336 hours post-dose
outcome.population: All participants that received a single 3 mg dose of omarigliptin.

group.title: Part 1: Mild Renal Impairment (Panel A)
group.description: Participants with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) ≥60 - <80 mL/min/1.73 m² were enrolled in the Mild Renal Impairment group.

group.title: Part 1: Control to Match Panel A (Panel B)
group.description: Participants with eGFR >/= 80 mL/min/1.73 m² were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel A.

group.title: Part 1: Moderate Renal Impairment (Panel C)
group.description: Participants with eGFR ≥30 - <60 mL/min/1.73 m² were enrolled in the Moderate Renal Impairment group.

group.title: Part 1: Control to Match Panel C (Panel D)
group.description: Participants with eGFR >/= 80 mL/min/1.73 m² were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel C.

group.title: Part 1: Severe Renal Impairment (Panel E)
group.description: Participants with eGFR <30 mL/min/1.73 m² but not on dialysis were enrolled in the Severe Renal Impairment group.

group.title: Part 1: Control to Match Panel E (Panel F)
group.description: Participants with eGFR >/= 80 mL/min/1.73 m² were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel E.

group.title: Part 2: ESRD Requiring HD (Panel G) - Period 1
group.description: Participants with end-stage renal disease (ESRD) requiring hemodialysis (HD) were enrolled in Panel G. In Period 1, participants received MK-3102 3 mg immediately after HD.

group.title: Part 2: Control to Match Panel G (Panel H) - Period 1
group.description: Participants were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel G. Data from one participant who withdrew from study and data from the replacement participant are both included.

group.title: Part 2: ESRD Requiring HD (Panel G) - Period 2
group.description: Participants with ESRD requiring HD were enrolled in Panel G. In Period 2, participants received MK-3102 3 mg 2 hours prior to HD.

group.title: Part 2: Control to Match Panel G (Panel H) - Period 2
group.description: Participants were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel G. Data from one participant who withdrew from study and data from the replacement participant are both included.

measure.title: Time to Maximum Concentration (Tmax) of Omarigliptin
measure.description: Tmax is a measure of the time to reach the maximum drug plasma concentration post-dose.
measure.population: All participants that received a single 3 mg dose of omarigliptin.

outcome.title: Apparent Terminal Half-life (t1/2) of Omarigliptin
outcome.description: T1/2 is the time required for the maximum concentration of a drug in the plasma to decrease by 50%.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72 (Panel G only), 96, 168, 240, and 336 hours post-dose
outcome.population: All participants that received a single 3 mg dose of omarigliptin.

group.title: Part 1: Mild Renal Impairment (Panel A)
group.description: Participants with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) ≥60 - <80 mL/min/1.73 m² were enrolled in the Mild Renal Impairment group.

group.title: Part 1: Control to Match Panel A (Panel B)
group.description: Participants with eGFR >/= 80 mL/min/1.73 m² were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel A.

group.title: Part 1: Moderate Renal Impairment (Panel C)
group.description: Participants with eGFR ≥30 - <60 mL/min/1.73 m² were enrolled in the Moderate Renal Impairment group.

group.title: Part 1: Control to Match Panel C (Panel D)
group.description: Participants with eGFR >/= 80 mL/min/1.73 m² were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel C.

group.title: Part 1: Severe Renal Impairment (Panel E)
group.description: Participants with eGFR <30 mL/min/1.73 m² but not on dialysis were enrolled in the Severe Renal Impairment group.

group.title: Part 1: Control to Match Panel E (Panel F)
group.description: Participants with eGFR >/= 80 mL/min/1.73 m² were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel E.

group.title: Part 2: ESRD Requiring HD (Panel G) - Period 1
group.description: Participants with end-stage renal disease (ESRD) requiring hemodialysis (HD) were enrolled in Panel G. In Period 1, participants received MK-3102 3 mg immediately after HD. One participant did not have an estimable parameter.

group.title: Part 2: Control to Match Panel G (Panel H) - Period 1
group.description: Participants were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel G. Data from the participant that withdrew from study was not included.

group.title: Part 2: ESRD Requiring HD (Panel G) - Period 2
group.description: Participants with ESRD requiring HD were enrolled in Panel G. In Period 2, participants received MK-3102 3 mg 2 hours prior to HD.

group.title: Part 2: Control to Match Panel G (Panel H) - Period 2
group.description: Participants were matched by age, gender, race, and body mass index (BMI) to participants in Panel G. Data from the participant that withdrew from study was not included.

measure.title: Apparent Terminal Half-life (t1/2) of Omarigliptin
measure.description: T1/2 is the time required for the maximum concentration of a drug in the plasma to decrease by 50%.
measure.population: All participants that received a single 3 mg dose of omarigliptin.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Experiencing an Adverse Event (AE)
outcome.description: An AE was defined as any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure (signs), function (symptoms), or chemistry (laboratory data) of the body temporally associated with any use of a Sponsor product, whether or not considered related to the use of the product.
outcome.time_frame: From pre-dose to 14 days post-dose (Up to Day 15)
outcome.population: All participants that received a single 3 mg dose of omarigliptin.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The SPONSOR must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the SPONSOR as confidential must be deleted prior to submission.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
